Hi, I am Alder Nadon.

I’m a senior mechanical engineering student at Northeastern University (3.95 GPA, Dean’s List all four years) from Santa Fe, NM. I chose engineering because I’ve always been fascinated by mechanical systems and wanted a career that pairs math‑and‑science rigor with real‑world impact.

My experience spans team design work (Arduino Laser Arcade Game, a Rube‑Goldberg‑style kinetics toy for Boston Children’s Museum) and personal technical projects like a WebGPU voxel engine and a Python terrain generator. I recently completed a 6‑month co‑op at BlueHalo as a Systems Engineering Intern, supporting requirements definition, decomposition, verification, and compliance reporting within an MBSE workflow using Cameo Systems Modeler. I regularly partnered with test teams to produce customer‑facing test reports for space‑qualified hardware (flight computers, fast‑steering mirrors/ECUs, optical space telescopes) under a rigorous verification program.
